dataList.dlg: Jack~ Are the knives sharpened? Mhm. Ready.
Wow, look over there! Walking ingredients! We'll just need to gather the meat once they kill 'em all.
They're looking sleepy.... They're dying. If they do bite it, we can use them as ingredients. How's that, Jack?
Watch out unless you want to become ground meat, hm? Don't worry about it, Pierre. It only means that we'll get pre-tenderized meat.
Oh. I like bringing in some fresh ones. Is that how you do your groceries, Jack?
Oh, did you let your guards down? They'll get themselves killed out there.
Ingredients trimmed. A bit messy, though. Right~? Chopping the ingredients down to the bone isn't the best way to prepare meat for pies.
Getting turned into ingredients while out to get ingredients...? Real amateurs. Right, Pierre?
Aw, this is a lost cause! Better run before you get turned into ground meat.
I guess they'll win eventually... but the meat's all spoiled on both sides. Tsk. We can't sell that.
Do you really have to go to this far for ingredients? Jack, you better run away if you ever find yourself in a situation like this, okay?
The ingredients are thrashing around. The more they thrash, the more tenderized their meats will be. Nice!
Huh? What are they getting ready for...? Let's hide.
Clean cut. Now that's a perfect cut of meat right there!
Oh, is that seriously what you're going to do...? You'll toughen the meat.
Knife for flesh, saw for bone! Agreed, Pierre.
That's a weird choice of tools. Phew... All they're doing is dulling their weapons.
The ingredients are looking particularly lively today. Looks like they did something to the meat.
They're looking tired. This is exactly when you need to beat'em so the meat doesn't get tough~
You sure do look energetic. Did you make them the pasty hand pies or something, Pierre? That's hearty.
They must've eaten tainted meat. Right...? They really don't look happy.
Wooow~ They chopped a whole piece of the ingredient off! Mhm. Looks like a gourmet cut to me.
The part they pulled off earlier. Can I go pick it up? Why not? At your leisure, Jack~
Ow, ow... That looks painful. Should've tied the ingredients down first.
Are you guys even equipped for this job? Gotta review the supplier contract, Pierre.
Wasn't that a bit too much? Yeah! Go easy on them~ Be careful not to shatter any bones, or otherwise we'll be serving pies with bone shards in them!
The pieces of meat you tore off just now? You better trim 'em before sending them over. I don't think they had much meat on their bones anyway...
That was a very efficient trimming... J-jack! You should try learning something like that, too!
Pierre here~ This is Jack. What should we cook up today?
